properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 11 at 8:21PM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Aberdeen SD
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected.
An Arctic front will move through the area between 6 and 8 am
Wednesday morning bringing an initial period of snow with very
strong north winds gusting up to 45 mph. Total snow
accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory,
very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 below
zero.

* WHERE...Spink County.

* WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 9 AM to 6 PM CST
Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Wednesday to
noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will
significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions
could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously
cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as
little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY
